info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 23 at 10:43PM EDT until March 23 at 11:15PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN MCDOWELL...NORTHEASTERN RUTHERFORD AND SOUTHWESTERN BURKE COUNTIES... At 1043 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located 12 miles southeast of Marion, or 12 miles west of South Mountains State Park, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This dangerous storm will be near... South Mountains State Park around 1100 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this tornadic thunderstorm include Glenwood, Thermal City, Fero, Dysartsville and Union Mills. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
